meanings.definition: To disembark from a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: Passengers will debark from the cruise ship at the port.
meanings.sent2: The travelers debark from the airplane after it lands.
meanings.sent3: After the long journey, everyone was eager to debark and explore the new destination.
meanings.sent4: As the final call was made, the passengers prepared to debark onto the bustling dock.
meanings.sent5: The crew assisted the elderly passengers to debark safely onto the waiting platform.

meanings.definition: To remove the bark from a tree.
meanings.sent1: The lumberjacks carefully debark the trees before transporting them.
meanings.sent2: In order to protect the trees, it is important to debark them properly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels watched curiously as the humans began to debark the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The process to debark the tree required precision and skill to avoid damaging the trunk.
meanings.sent5: The arborist used a specialized tool to debark the tree and inspect its health.
